intro: Eremophila battii var. major, commonly known as the large-flowered eremophila, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its compact shrub form, with narrow, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, tubular flowers range in color from pink to red, typically blooming in spring. This species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in harsh conditions.
